words.def: a form of energy that is transferred by a difference in temperature
A very emphatic synonym of the verb hate.
With a comparative or more and a verb phrase, establishes a parallel with one or more other such comparatives.
made warm or hot (`het' is a dialectal variant of `heated')
headdress that protects the head from bad weather

A letter capital Ð, small ð introduced into Old English to represent its dental fricative, then not distinguished from the letter thorn, no longer used in English but still in modern use in Icelandic, Faroese, and phonetics to represent the voiced dental fricative "th" sound as in the English word then.
a terrorist organization organized in 1959 by student activists who were dissatisfied with the moderate nationalism of the traditional Basque party
goddess of criminal rashness and its punishment
a beverage made by steeping tea leaves in water
An instance of the interjection ah.
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
(astronomy) the angular distance of a celestial point measured westward along the celestial equator from the zenith crossing
a hard grey lustrous metallic element that is highly resistant to corrosion
a highly unstable radioactive element (the heaviest of the halogen series)
